text: The was a historical government system in Japan where households would be required to register with Buddhist Temples. Marcure (1985) This effectively put a lot of the work of administration on the temples rather than the government. It was used to persecute Christians.Tamamuro Fumio In the Meiji Restoration it was replaced with Shrine Parishioner Registration. == Related pages == * Freedom of religion * Shrine Parishioner Registration == References == Category:History of Japan
